entry.title: Emotet
entry.summary: Emotet is a sophisticated malware strain and cybercrime operation, first detected in 2014. Initially a banking Trojan, it evolved into a highly modular loader and botnet, delivering other malware like TrickBot, QBot, Ryuk, and IcedID, and often used in ransomware campaigns.

entry.title: Really Simple Security? More like Really Simple Hacking!(CVE-2024-10924)

link.title: Really Simple Security? More like Really Simple Hacking!(CVE-2024-10924)

entry.summary: CVE-2024-10924 Really Simple Security WordPress plugin, affecting versions 9.0.0 to 9.1.1.1. The flaw enables attackers to bypass authentication, potentially gaining admin access to sites if the plugin’s two-factor authentication is enabled. What is Really Simple Security The Really Simple Security plugin formerly known as “Really Simple SSL,” is a popular WordPress plugin used to enhance ...

entry.title: Static Analysis with WinDbg and IDA

link.title: Static Analysis with WinDbg and IDA

entry.summary: While examining compiled executables from low-level languages like C or C++ we often do not have access to the source code. In this case, an analysis of the binary can help us understand the structure, content, and flow of a binary executable itself A debugger like WinDbg8 for example, can help us to display instructions in plain ordered assembly Using WinDbg and IDA in binary analysis Add...

entry.title: Automating Workflows with /dev(?:sec)?ops/i
entry.summary: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). It aims to shorten the systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high software quality. DevOps has emerged as the leading approach in software and product development, offering enhanced visibility, improved coordination, and faster iterations compared to traditional method...
